intro: Anethum arvense, commonly known as field parsley, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its root system is fibrous, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Field parsley is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields, where it spreads through its seeds and rhizomes.
